answers.q: is ammonium carbonate soluble in water
answers.a: Yes—ammonium carbonate is readily soluble in water; its solutions are alkaline and release ammonia, especially when warmed.

answers.q: is ammonium carbonate ionic or covalent
answers.a: It is an ionic salt composed of ammonium (NH4+) cations and carbonate (CO3^2-) anions.

answers.q: what is ammonium carbonate used for
answers.a: In foods it’s used as a leavening (raising) agent, especially in low-moisture baked goods like cookies and crackers; it’s also used in smelling salts.
Yes; it is soluble in water but essentially insoluble in ethanol, and it decomposes to ammonia and carbon dioxide when heated.
